regexCodeList.string: ^You spit a stream of acidic venom at (.+) who writhes in agony as the spittle seeps into (his|her) skin\.$
^You form small chunks of ice in your enormous maw\, then spit them at (.+) in a barrage\.$
^You charge quickly at (.+)\, throwing your mighty form into (him|her) and sending (him|her) staggering back\.$
^You swing your mighty tail around\, stabbing (.+) with an acid\-covered spine\.$
^You breathe a column of icy air at (.+)\'s head\, stunning (him|her)\.$
^You psychically slam your mind into (.+)\'s\, deadening (his|her) reactions\.$
^You spit a thick gob of slime at (.+)\, coating (him|her) and inhibiting (his|her) ability to heal\.$
^You slap your tail on the ground while growling at (.+)\, forcing (him|her) to recklessly attack\.$
^You breathe at (.+)\, small bolts of lightning crackling around (him|her) and sensitizing (his|her) skin\.$
^You bathe .+\'s translucent shield in your noxious breath\, dissolving it\.$
^.+\'s translucent shield cracks and fades away as you breathe an icy blast at it\.$
^.+\'s translucent shield fades away as you cover it with your deadly wyrmvenom\.$
^You blast .+ with psychic energy\, demolishing (?:his|her|its) translucent shield\.$
^You breathe a white\-hot blast of flame at .+ and burn away (?:his|her|its) translucent shield\.$
^A bolt of lightning cracks out from your maw and obliterates .+\'s translucent shield\.$
^You barrel into (.+) and knock (him|her) to the ground before stomping over (his|her) prone form\.$
^You level your draconic gaze at (.+)\, assaulting (him|her) with psychic waves of force\.$
^You breathe a long torrent of flame at (.+), igniting (his|her) skin\.$
^You open your cavernous maw and summon a blast of lightning to pulverize (.+)\.$
^You breathe a wave of icy air at (.+)\.$
^You summon a psychic storm around (.+)\, but (he|she) stands strong against the buffeting winds\.$
^Positioning your mighty head over (.+)\, you let your acidic saliva flow over (him|her)\. (He|She) screams in agony as some of the poison splashes over (him|her)\.$
^You blast (.+) with a bath of flame\, but (he|she) is able to avoid the brunt of the blast\.$
^You breathe a series of lightning strikes in a lattice around (.+)\, but (he|she) is able to quickly dart through the lattice and avoid the bulk of the lightning strikes\.$
^You breathe a series of lightning strikes in a lattice around (.+)\.(\s+)(He|She) absent\-mindedly strides into the lattice as the lightning crackles into (his|her) skin\.$
^You open your gigantic maw and spew acid on (.+)\. (He|She) dodges to the side and is only partially covered by the corrosive slime\.$
^You open your gigantic maw and spew acid on (.+)\. (She|He) is too clumsy to dodge the deluge and is coated in the corrosive slime\.$
^You open your enormous maw and let loose a mighty roar at (.+)\, causing (him|her) to quail in fear\.$
^You let loose a steady stream of cold air around (.+)\, who begins to shiver uncontrollably\.$
^You summon sparkles of psi energy around (.+)\, causing (him|her) to forget (his|her) actions as the sparkles distract (him|her)\.$
^You snap your head forward and sink your teeth into (.+)\, your poisonous teeth injecting (him|her) with a weakening toxin\.$
^You blacken (.+)\'s flesh with a quick blast of flame\, slowing (his|her) healing process\.$
^You puff small bolts of lightning at (.+)\, enraging (him|her) and causing (him|her) to attack recklessly\.$
^You quickly mix together several chemical by\-products and fling the toxic mixture into (.+)\t\'s face\, causing (him|her) to cough and choke\.$
^You sketch a bisected triangle in the air and direct the energy of cadmium to pierce (.+)\'s skin\, weakening (him|her)\.$
^You mix together the ingredients of the caustic chemical and fling it at .+\'s shield\, watching as it is consumed\.$
^You sketch out the symbol for magnesium and direct the energy of iron to sear (.+)\'s flesh\.$
^You sketch out the symbol for magnesium and direct the energy to sear (.+)\'s flesh\.$
^You quickly combine and throw the virulent pathogen at (.+)\. The chemical seeps through (his|her) skin but (he|she) is able to fight off the worst of its effects\.$
^You quickly combine and throw the virulent pathogen at (.+)\. The chemical seeps through (his|her) skin and wreaks havoc on (his|her) weakened regeneration\.$
^Taking care to avoid the fumes\, you quickly form the hypnotic chemical and throw it into (.+)\'s face\.$
^You twist your wrist swiftly\, slicing (.+) with a long slash of your sweeping blade\.$
^You direct your voice in a high\-pitched trill at (.+)\, dazing (him|her)\.$
^You hum a low note at .+\, causing (?:his|her|its) translucent shield to shatter as it resonates with the power of your voice\.$
^You use your powerful voice to distract (.+) with a ululating howl before stepping in with a vicious slash\.$
^Your careful footwork leads you in a tight spin past .+\, but (?:he|she|it) is able to avoid the worst of your slashing blade\.$
^Your careful footwork leads you in a tight spin past .+\, (?:his|her|its) stunned state preventing (?:him|her|it) from dodging your slashing blade\.$
^You direct a soothing song at (.+)\, enticing (him|her) into defending you\.$

TriggerGroup.name: Blademaster
TriggerGroup.script: -- Thanks to Crono and Praxides for supplying

regexCodeList.string: ^A Shin\-enhanced leap flings you high into the air\. You extend one knee downwards as you begin to fall\, squarely striking (.+) and driving (him|her|it) to the ground as you land\.$
^You hurl a precise blast of Shin energy at (.+)\'s eyes\.$
^You unleash a burst of Shin energy at .+\, tearing apart (?:his|her|its) translucent shield\.$
^You twist in a tight circle\, slashing (.+) with each spin\.$
^You deliver a glancing blow to (.+)\'s head\.$
^You lightly stab (.+) in several key locations with your blade\, causing (him|her|it) to slump weakly\.$
^You command the shadow of (.+) to begin siphoning away the life of its host\.$
^You summon whips of shadow to viciously lash the form of (.+)\.$
^Bending your formidable will upon (.+)\, you slow the passage of time about (?:him|her) to a crawl\.$
^Directing your power against the magical shield surrounding (.+)\, you intone\, \'Nakail\.$
^Directing your power against the magical shield surrounding (.+)\, you intone\, \'Nakail'\.$
^Directing your power against the magical shield surrounding (.+)\, you intone\, \"Nakail"\.$
^You viciously eradicate parts of the concept of (.+) from the timestream\.$
^Locking your gaze to that of (.+)\, you (?:i|e)ntone\, \'Boinad\'\.$
^Locking your gaze to that of (.+)\, you (?:i|e)ntone\, \"Boinad\"\.$
^You point your quarterstaff at (.+) and summon vines from it to strangle (.+)\.$
^At your command\, undergrowth rises from the ground under (.+) and pierces (his|her) skin\, stealing (his|her) energy and making (him|her) weak\.$
^You clench one fist before .+ and vines grow up to entangle (his|her|its) translucent shield\, shattering it as they constrict\.$
^You roar in rage and spring upon (.+) and ravage (him|her) with your fangs and claws\.$
^You hold your quarterstaff aloft and focus a beam of intense sunlight on the stunned form of (.+) who hastily averts (his|her) eyes before any significant damage can be done to them\.$
^You hold your quarterstaff aloft and focus a beam of intense sunlight on (.+)\. Foolishly\, (.+) stares straight at the dazzling light and screams as (his|her) eyes are seared\.$
^You cause the tip of your quarterstaff to glow brightly before thrusting it at the face of (.+)\. (.+) recoils from the blinding light and begins to stagger about clumsily\.$
^(.+) thrashes in agony as necromantic forces ravage (his|her) brain\.$

Trigger.name: Soulshield (2 infernal)
Trigger.script:
rageGUI.useAbility("soulshield")
-- Your soulshield absorbs the damage but the black flames intensify. -- A torrent of black flame rushes out and back at you in a small loop, burning you. -- The miasma of black flames around you dissipates.

regexCodeList.string: A miasma of black flames springs up around you.
^Dark energy wreathes .+ as you slash at .+ with it\, causing (?:his|her|its) translucent shield to crumble\.$
^You leap upon (.+), forming putrid spikes on your armour that tear into (his|her) flesh\.$
^Dark fire courses down (.+) as you strike (.+) with a solid blow\.$

Trigger.name: Deathlink (6 infernal)
Trigger.script:
rageGUI.useAbility("deathlink")
-- ^You feel a sudden surge of pain as the ethereal thread connecting you to (\w+) flares brightly\.$ -- ^The ethereal thread connecting you to (\w+) fades away\.$

regexCodeList.string: ^You gesture at (\w+) and a fragile ethereal thread forms into existence between you\.$
^You wrap .+ in a tight headlock and repeatedly rub your knuckles painfully across (?:his|her|its) scalp\.$
^You take a pinch of diamond dust and flick it at .+\'s face. (?:He|She|It) begins to cough and retch to expel the fine dust\.$
^You throw a handful of small metallic jacks at .+\, the sharpened points shredding (?:his|her|its) translucent shield\.$
^You discretely secret a lit firecracker to .+\. After a few moments\, the firecracker explodes\, leaving a blistering wound\.$
^You strike up a bantering dialogue with .+\, but you\'re only able to cause a minor headache\.$
^You strike up a dialogue with .+\, gleefully mocking (?:his|her|its) forgetfulness and causing a great headache as (?:he|she|it) is not able to keep up\.$
^You whistle innocuously as you saunter by .+\, then suddenly spin and whip (?:him|her|it) in the back of the head with your blackjack\, stunning (?:him|her|it)\.$
^You draw upon the power of air to summon sharp gusts of wind which begin to whip across (.*)'s exposed flesh\.$
^You summon a polar vortex in a tight field around (.*)\, chilling the small pocket so intensely that time itself begins to slow\.$
^You summon a whirlwind of flame around .+ which consumes (?:his|her|its) translucent shield\.$
^At your command\, a crystalline golem stomps over to (.*) and wraps (him|her) in a tight embrace\, squeezing the life from (him|her)\.$
^You raise your hands dramatically and summon a mighty flaming rock from the sky down at (.*)\, but (he|she) dodges aside and is only dealt a glancing blow\.$
^You raise your hands dramatically and summon a mighty flaming rock from the sky that slams into the clumsy form of (.*)\.$
^A bolt of lightning roars out from your hands as you cast a powerful spell at (.*)\, inciting sensitive nerves across (his|her) skin\.$

TriggerGroup.name: Monk
TriggerGroup.script: --Thanks to Rohai for supplying most --Thanks to Rekhyr for Mindblast line 3

regexCodeList.string: ^You spin and strike .+ with the back of your fist\.$
^You rummage quickly through .+\'s mind\, finding the link to fine motor control before exerting a small amount of psychic force and deadening it\.$
^You focus your rage in a single powerful sidekick\, shattering .+\'s translucent shield\.$
^You leap and spin in the air\, striking .+ repeatedly with an outstretched foot\.$
^Marshalling your psychic reserves\, you hurl them in a blast at .+\.$
^Marshalling your psychic reserves\, you hurl them in a blast at .+\. (?:His|Her|Its) weakened body recoils from the psychic assault\.$
^Marshalling your psychic reserves\, you hurl them in a blast at .+\, clamping on the already jangled nerves of your target\.$
^You quickly strike .+ with the tips of your fingers\, targeting specific nerves\.$

Trigger.name: Harry (1 occultist)
Trigger.script:
rageGUI.useAbility("harry")
--^.+ is tormented by horrific visions from the Plane of Chaos\.$

regexCodeList.string: ^Raising your hands in the air, you summon horrific visions to torment .+\.$
^Multicolored rays burst forth from your outstretched hands and strike .+ in the head, forcing (?:her|him|it) to obey your will\.$
^You gesture in a slashing motion at .+\, and small tears form in (?:his|her|its) translucent shield as chaos rips it apart\.$
^You cup your hands together and fling them outwards sending a spiral of shimmering portals into .+\'s body\.$
^You concentrate intently on .+ and watch as grotesque mutations sprout all over (?:her|his|its) body\.$
^You wave one arm at .+?\, causing a small time rift to form around (?:him|her|it)\.$

Trigger.name: Harrow (1 paladin)
Trigger.script:
rageGUI.useAbility("harrow")
-- ^Praying to the Gods\, you lay a harrowing rite on (.+)\'s body and watch as (he|she) arches (his|her) back in agony\.$

A deadly root flies from your hand and burrows into

Trigger.name: Rage gain
Trigger.script: if rageGUI.guibr_vars.gag then deleteLine() end rageGUI.rageFadeTimers()

regexCodeList.string: [Rage]:

Trigger.name: Rage fades
Trigger.script:
if rageGUI.guibr_vars.gag or rageGUI.guibr_vars.fadewarn then deleteLine()
end

regexCodeList.string: Your rage fades away.

Trigger.name: Detect dragon colour from summoned breath
Trigger.script:
rageGUI.dragonbreath = matches[2]:lower()
if rage1.message:find("Rage") then rageGUI.updateRageCaptions() end

regexCodeList.string: ^Your (\w+) summoning is complete\.$
^Your rage is wasted as .+ is not protected by a shield\.$
As the earth rises to clad your growing form

As the earth rises to clad your growing form in a skin of stone, you scream out in triumph, the very blood of Earth surging through your granite veins. By the will of Garash, Earth is yours to command!
With a victorious roar, you bellow your triumph into the firmament.

With a victorious roar, you bellow your triumph into the firmament. A pillar of flame erupts at your feet and surges forth, searing the ground at your feet. From beneath a vermilion veil, you gaze out upon the world, and all seems as fuel before you. By the will of Kkractle, Fire is yours to command!
^You call down a lightning bolt to destroy .+\.$
^You rip the breath from .+\, depriving h(?:im|er) of air for several seconds and leaving h(?:im|er) gasping and weak\.$
^You form a localised twister\, spinning it at incredible speed to form a drill that plunges straight through the magical shield surrounding .+\, utterly destroying it\.$
^You send a crushing wave of pressurised air at .+\, pulverising h(?:im|er)\.
^You raise the pressure surrounding .+ to terrible heights\, but (?:|s)he manages to struggle free of your intangible grasp\.$
^You raise the pressure surrounding the already vulnerable form of .+ to terrible heights\, crushing the life from h(?:im|er)\.
^You bring a vacuum into being with .+ at the centre\, denying h(?:im|er) any chance at breathing\.$
^You bring one of your stone fists down upon .+ in a smashing blow\.$
^You manifest rocks directly above .+\, burying h(?:im|er) under a cascading hammer of stone\.$
^Wreathing yourself in magma\, you charge into .+\, smashing through the magical shield that surrounds h(?:im|er) with the might of your stone\-forged form.\$
^Imbuing your form with the might of earth\, you launch a terrible assault upon .+\, raining blow after blow down upon h(?:im|er) with your empowered fists\.$
^You call up a column of magma to strike down .+\, but (?:|s)he steps back away from the danger\.$
^You call up a column of magma\, sending it crashing over the helpless form of .+\.$
^You move to stand before \w+ ready to protect h(?:im|er) from harm\.$
^Summoning forth the primal fires\, you engulf .+ in flames\!$
^You scourge .+ with a whip of flame\, leaving h(?:im|er) sensitive and raw\.$
^Raising a hand\, you send forth thin wires of flame\, their searing filaments tearing through the magical shield surrounding .+\.$
^You call forth a raging firestorm to destroy .+\, its insatiable fury falling upon h(?:im|er) with ravenous intent\.$
^You unleash a raging cataclysm of destruction\, the area directly surrounding .+ becoming nothing but fire and ash\.
^You prepare to unleash a cataclysm against .+\, but (?:|s)he anticipates your intent and moves out of your target area\.$
^You unleash a raging cataclysm of destruction\, the area directly surrounding .+ becoming nothing but fire and ash\.$
^You manifest a net of flame and cast it about the form of .+\.$
^You manifest icicles from the vapour surrounding you\, casting them in a deadly volley at .+\.$
^You dehydrate the moisture from .+\, leaving h(?:im|er) swaying and unsteady\.$
^You form a giant hammer out of water and bring it crashing down upon the magical shield surrounding .+\, destroying it\.$
^You call down a rain of needle\-sharp spears of ice\, sending them plunging into the body of .+\.$
^You bring down a deluge upon a goblin guard\, but (?:|s)he leaps back out of the range\, suffering little more than a faceful of icy spray\.$
^You begin to draw the fluid from .+\, h(?:is|er) vitality draining even as your form becomes greater\.$

Alias.name: Set Rage Ally
Alias.script: rageAlly = matches[2] rageGUI.echoN("BattleRage ally set to "..matches[2]:lower():title())

Alias.name: Toggle rage GUI
Alias.script: if not rageGUI.hidden then ragePane:hide() rageGUI.hidden = 1 else rageGUI.buildRagePane() rageGUI.hidden = nil end

Script.name: Battlerage config
Script.script:
-- BATTLERAGE CONFIG
-- v1.7 onwards, DO NOT EDIT THIS SCRIPT. Use 'rageshow' and 'rageset' aliases instead
rageGUI = rageGUI or {} rageGUI.guibr_vars = rageGUI.guibr_vars or {}
rageGUI.set_guibr_vars = function()
rageGUI.guibr_vars = {
gag = true ,-- gag Achaea RAGEMSG GAIN messages (config must be on for certain scripts to function)
fadewarn = true ,-- give warnings 5, 3 and 1 second before rage fades, requires CONFIG RAGEMSG GAIN delay = 5 ,-- number of seconds before rage fade timer displays showaffs = true ,-- displays denizen aff gain / loss votb = false ,-- have artefact power to extend rage decay timer
on = "green" ,-- colour of available rage off = "grey" ,-- colour of unavailable rage fg = "tomato" ,-- colour of active rage (timer foreground) bg = "black" ,-- colour of timer background
h = 20 ,-- height of rage timers (total = 5*guibr_h+6) w = 100 ,-- width of rage gui x = 100 ,-- distance from left of screen for rage gui y = 100 ,-- distance from top of screen for rage gui
--css styling for BattleRage GUI container style = [[border-width: 2px; border-color: #400020; border-style: groove; border-radius: 1; ]],
element = "none", -- required for elemental lord }
end
local _sep_ = "/"
rageGUI.load_guibr_vars = function(x)
if x then if rageGUI.rageLoaded then return end end
rageGUI.rageLoaded = true --prevent constantly overwriting
if string.char(getMudletHomeDir():byte()) == "/" then _sep_ = "/" else _sep_ = "\\" end
local filename = getMudletHomeDir().._sep_.."guibr_vars.lua"
if io.exists(filename) then table.load(filename, rageGUI.guibr_vars) rageGUI.echoN("Loaded BattleRage GUI settings")
else rageGUI.set_guibr_vars() rageGUI.echoN("BattleRage GUI settings not found, using defaults")
end
end
rageGUI.save_guibr_vars = function()
if string.char(getMudletHomeDir():byte()) == "/" then _sep_ = "/" else _sep_ = "\\" end
filename = getMudletHomeDir().._sep_.."guibr_vars.lua" if io.exists(filename) then os.execute("del "..filename) end
table.save(filename, rageGUI.guibr_vars)
rageGUI.echoN("Battlerage GUI settings saved successfully")
end
rageGUI.echoN = function(line)
moveCursorEnd("main") if getCurrentLine() ~= "" then echo("\n") end cecho("<tomato>[<white>Rage<tomato>]:<lavender_blush> "..line.."<reset>\n")
end
rageGUI.echo = function(line)
cecho("<tomato>[<white>Rage<tomato>]:<lavender_blush> "..line)
end
rageGUI.load_guibr_vars("first run")

Script.name: Battlerage table
Battlerage main
Script.script:
-- BATTLERAGE MAIN -- DO NOT EDIT THIS SCRIPT
rageGUI = rageGUI or {}
rageGUI.version = "1.8.2"
rageGUI.timeout = 15
local debugMode = true
-- increase timeout if character has Vambraces of the Berserker if rageGUI.guibr_vars.votb then rageGUI.timeout = rageGUI.timeout + 5 end
rageGUI.myRage = function()
local rage = 0 for k, v in pairs(gmcp.Char.Vitals.charstats) do if string.starts(v, "Rage") then rage = tonumber(string.match(v,"%d+")) end end return rage
end
rageGUI.label = rageGUI.label or {}
rageGUI.label.css = { ["border-width"] = "1px", ["border-color"] = "#000000", ["border-style"] = "solid", ["border-radius"] = "4px", }
rageGUI.on = [[ border-width: ]]..rageGUI.label.css["border-width"]..[[; border-color: ]]..rageGUI.label.css["border-color"]..[[; border-style: ]]..rageGUI.label.css["border-style"]..[[; border-radius: ]]..rageGUI.label.css["border-radius"]..[[; background-color: rgba(]]..table.concat(color_table[rageGUI.guibr_vars.on],", ")..[[, 150); ]]
rageGUI.off = [[ border-width: ]]..rageGUI.label.css["border-width"]..[[; border-color: ]]..rageGUI.label.css["border-color"]..[[; border-style: ]]..rageGUI.label.css["border-style"]..[[; border-radius: ]]..rageGUI.label.css["border-radius"]..[[; background-color: rgba(]]..table.concat(color_table[rageGUI.guibr_vars.off],", ")..[[, 50); ]]
rageGUI.timerbg = [[ border-width: ]]..rageGUI.label.css["border-width"]..[[; border-color: ]]..rageGUI.label.css["border-color"]..[[; border-style: ]]..rageGUI.label.css["border-style"]..[[; border-radius: ]]..rageGUI.label.css["border-radius"]..[[; background-color: rgba(]]..table.concat(color_table[rageGUI.guibr_vars.bg],", ")..[[, 150); ]]
rageGUI.timerfg = [[ border-width: ]]..rageGUI.label.css["border-width"]..[[; border-color: ]]..rageGUI.label.css["border-color"]..[[; border-style: ]]..rageGUI.label.css["border-style"]..[[; border-radius: ]]..rageGUI.label.css["border-radius"]..[[; background-color: rgba(]]..table.concat(color_table[rageGUI.guibr_vars.fg],", ")..[[, 150); ]]
rageGUI.tooltip = [[ border-width: 1px; border-style: solid; border-color: blue; border-radius: 4px; background-color: rgba(0,0,128,150); ]]
rageGUI.timers = rageGUI.timers or {} rageGUI.rageTable = rageGUI.rageTable or {}
rageGUI.buildRagePane = function()
local xPos = rageGUI.guibr_vars.x local yPos = rageGUI.guibr_vars.y local b = 3
if GuiContainer then xPos = tonumber(string.match(GuiContainer.x,"%d+"))-rageGUI.guibr_vars.w end if pane_tradeskills then yPos = tonumber(string.match(pane_tradeskills.height,"%d+"))+tonumber(string.match(pane_tradeskills.y,"%d+")) end
ragePane = Geyser.Label:new({ name = "ragePane", x = xPos, y = yPos, width = rageGUI.guibr_vars.w, height = (rageGUI.guibr_vars.h*7)+(b*2), }) ragePane:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.guibr_vars.style)
local w = rageGUI.guibr_vars.w-(b*2)
rageVBox = Geyser.VBox:new({ name = "rageVBox", x = b, y = b, width = w, height = ragePane.height:match("%d+")-(b*2), }, ragePane)
rage1 = Geyser.Label:new({ name = "rage1", fontSize = 8, message = [[<center>Rage 1</center>]], }, rageVBox) rage1:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.off)
rage2 = Geyser.Label:new({ name = "rage2",
fontSize = 8, message = [[<center>Rage 2</center>]], }, rageVBox) rage2:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.off)
rage3 = Geyser.Label:new({ name = "rage3", fontSize = 8, message = [[<center>Rage 3</center>]], }, rageVBox) rage3:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.off)
rage4 = Geyser.Label:new({ name = "rage4", fontSize = 8, message = [[<center>Rage 4</center>]], }, rageVBox) rage4:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.off)
rage5 = Geyser.Label:new({ name = "rage5", fontSize = 8, message = [[<center>Rage 5</center>]], }, rageVBox) rage5:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.off)
rage6 = Geyser.Label:new({ name = "rage6", fontSize = 9, message = [[<center>Rage 6</center>]], }, rageVBox) rage6:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.off)
rageB = Geyser.Label:new({ name = "rageB", fontSize = 8, message = [[<center>Rage Balance</center>]], }, rageVBox) rageB:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.on)
rageGUI.updateRageCaptions()
if not demonnic.anitimer then rageGUI.noAnitimer() end
if svo then svo.adddefinition("@rageGUIrage", "rageGUI.myRage()") end
end
rageGUI.updateRageCaptions = function(cls)
if not cls then if not gmcp then if debugMode then rage.echo("DEBUG: No GMCP, cannot update rage captions") end return end
if not gmcp.Char then if debug.Mode then rage.echo("DEBUG: No gmcp.Char, cannot update rage captions") end return end
cls = gmcp.Char.Status.class:lower() end
cls = tostring(cls:gsub("lady", "lord")) --female elemental lords are ladies
if debugMode then rageGUI.echo("DEBUG: Running rageGUI.updateRageCaptions with class \""..cls.."\"") end
for k, v in pairs(rageGUI.guibr_vars) do if v == "false" then rageGUI.guibr_vars[k] = false end end
if not gmcp.Char then return end rageGUI.rageTable = rageGUI.tblBattleRage[cls]
if not rageGUI.rageTable then return end
rage1:echo(rageGUI.rageTable[1][1]:title().." ("..rageGUI.rageTable[1][3]..")","white","c") rage1:setClickCallback("rageGUI.rageClick",rageGUI.rageTable[1][5])
rage2:echo(rageGUI.rageTable[2][1]:title().." ("..rageGUI.rageTable[2][3]..")","white","c") rage2:setClickCallback("rageGUI.rageClick",rageGUI.rageTable[2][5])
rage3:echo(rageGUI.rageTable[3][1]:title().." ("..rageGUI.rageTable[3][3]..")","white","c") rage3:setClickCallback("rageGUI.rageClick",rageGUI.rageTable[3][5])
rage4:echo(rageGUI.rageTable[4][1]:title().." ("..rageGUI.rageTable[4][3]..")","white","c") rage4:setClickCallback("rageGUI.rageClick",rageGUI.rageTable[4][5])
rage5:echo(rageGUI.rageTable[5][1]:title().." ("..rageGUI.rageTable[5][3]..")","white","c") rage5:setClickCallback("rageGUI.rageClick",rageGUI.rageTable[5][5])
rage6:echo(rageGUI.rageTable[6][1]:title().." ("..rageGUI.rageTable[6][3]..")","white","c") rage6:setClickCallback("rageGUI.rageClick",rageGUI.rageTable[6][5])
if getMudletVersion then --must be on version 3+ rage1:setOnEnter("rageGUI.rageEnter",1) rage1:setOnLeave("rageGUI.rageLeave") rage2:setOnEnter("rageGUI.rageEnter",2) rage2:setOnLeave("rageGUI.rageLeave") rage3:setOnEnter("rageGUI.rageEnter",3) rage3:setOnLeave("rageGUI.rageLeave") rage4:setOnEnter("rageGUI.rageEnter",4) rage4:setOnLeave("rageGUI.rageLeave") rage5:setOnEnter("rageGUI.rageEnter",5) rage5:setOnLeave("rageGUI.rageLeave") rage6:setOnEnter("rageGUI.rageEnter",6) rage6:setOnLeave("rageGUI.rageLeave") end
end
rageGUI.updateRagePane = function()
if not rageGUI.rageTable then return end
local rage = rageGUI.myRage() local lvl = tonumber(gmcp.Char.Status.level:match("%d+",1))
if rage1.message:find("Rage") then rageGUI.updateRageCaptions() end -- need to update captions
if not timerRage1 and lvl >= rageGUI.lvls[1] then if rage >= rageGUI.rageTable[1][3] then rage1:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.on) else rage1:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.off) end end
if not timerRage2 and lvl >= rageGUI.lvls[2] then if rage >= rageGUI.rageTable[2][3] then rage2:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.on) else rage2:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.off) end end
if not timerRage3 and lvl >= rageGUI.lvls[3] then if rage >= rageGUI.rageTable[3][3] then rage3:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.on) else rage3:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.off) end end
if not timerRage4 and lvl >= rageGUI.lvls[4] then if rage >= rageGUI.rageTable[4][3] then rage4:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.on) else rage4:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.off) end end
if not timerRage5 and lvl >= rageGUI.lvls[5] then if rage >= rageGUI.rageTable[5][3] then rage5:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.on) else rage5:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.off) end end
if not timerRage6 and lvl >= rageGUI.lvls[6] then if rage >= rageGUI.rageTable[6][3] then rage6:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.on) else rage6:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.off) end end
rageB:echo("Rage: "..rageGUI.myRage(),"white","c")
end
rageGUI.rageClick = function(rage)
if not target then rage = tostring(rage:gsub("at myTarget","at")) --curse you, Tharvis! rage = tostring(rage:gsub("myTarget","")) else rage = tostring(rage:gsub("myTarget",target)) --for offensive end
if rageAlly then rage = tostring(rage:gsub("myAlly",rageAlly)) end --for defensive send(rage,false) rageGUI.updateRagePane()
end
rageGUI.rageEnter = function(x)
local width, height = getMainWindowSize()
local xPos = ragePane.x:match("%d+") - 153 if xPos < 0 then xPos = ragePane.x:match("%d+")+ragePane.width:match("%d+")+3 end --display on right if no room on left
local msg, _ = string.gsub(rageGUI.rageTable[x][6],"Aff:","")
rageTT = Geyser.Label:new({ name = "rageTT", x = xPos, y = ragePane.y:match("%d+")+(rageGUI.guibr_vars.h*(x-1))+3, width = 150, height = 20, fontSize = 7, message = [[<center>]]..msg..[[</center>]], }) rageTT:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.tooltip)
if rageGUI.TTTimer then killTimer(rageGUI.TTTimer) rageGUI.TTTimer = nil end rageGUI.TTTimer = tempTimer(2.0, [[rageTT:hide() killTimer(rageGUI.TTTimer) rageGUI.TTTimer = nil]] ) -- close the tooltip message box after 2.0 seconds
end
rageGUI.rageLeave = function()
if rageGUI.TTTimer then killTimer(rageGUI.TTTimer) rageGUI.TTTimer = nil end rageTT:hide()
end
rageGUI.rageKey = function(k)
rageGUI.rageClick(rageGUI.rageTable[k][5])
end
rageGUI.rageTimer = function(N,L,D,C)
local H = tonumber(rageGUI.guibr_vars.h)
rageBal = 0 raiseEvent("rageGUI rage balance","lost")
if rageGUI.timers.bal then killTimer(rageGUI.timers.bal) rageGUI.timers.bal = nil end rageGUI.timers.bal = tempTimer(1, [[ rageBal = 1 killTimer(rageGUI.timers.bal) rageGUI.timers.bal = nil raiseEvent("rageGUI rage balance","gained") ]])
if not demonnic.anitimer then if anitimer then demonnic.anitimer = mmp.deepcopy(anitimer) else rageGUI.noAnitimer() end else W = tonumber(string.match(rage1.width,"%d+")) demonnic.anitimer:new(N, {x = 0, y = 0, height = H, width = W}, D, {container = C, showTime = true, timerCaption = L, cssFront = rageGUI.timerfg, cssBack = rageGUI.timerbg}) end
end
rageGUI.noAnitimer = function()
rageGUI.echo("Anitimer not detected on your system - download from <reset>") cechoLink("<pink>Github<reset>", [[(openUrl or openURL)"https://github.com/demonnic/animatedtimers"]], "Download Anitimer from Github",true) echo("\n")
end
rageGUI.rageFadeTimers = function() if rageGUI.timers.fade1 then killTimer(rageGUI.timers.fade1) rageGUI.timers.fade1 = nil end if rageGUI.timers.fade2 then killTimer(rageGUI.timers.fade2) rageGUI.timers.fade2 = nil end if rageGUI.timers.fade3 then killTimer(rageGUI.timers.fade3) rageGUI.timers.fade3 = nil end if rageGUI.timers.fade4 then killTimer(rageGUI.timers.fade4) rageGUI.timers.fade4 = nil end
-- fade timer, suggested by Azuros demonnic.anitimer:destroy("timerRageB") local x = rageGUI.delay or 5 local y = rageGUI.timeout-getNetworkLatency()-x if rageGUI.timers.fadeB then killTimer(rageGUI.timers.fadeB) rageGUI.timers.fadeB = nil end rageGUI.timers.fadeB = tempTimer(x, function() rageGUI.rageTimer("timerRageB", "Rage: "..rageGUI.myRage(), y, rageB) end) -- end fade timer
if rageGUI.guibr_vars.fadewarn then local tm = rageGUI.timeout-getNetworkLatency() rageGUI.timers.fade1 = tempTimer(tm-6, function() killTimer(rageGUI.timers.fade1) rageGUI.timers.fade1 = nil raiseEvent("rageGUI fade", 6) end) rageGUI.timers.fade2 = tempTimer(tm-3, function() killTimer(rageGUI.timers.fade2) rageGUI.timers.fade2 = nil raiseEvent("rageGUI fade", 3) end) rageGUI.timers.fade3 = tempTimer(tm-1, function() killTimer(rageGUI.timers.fade3) rageGUI.timers.fade3 = nil raiseEvent("rageGUI fade", 1) end) rageGUI.timers.fade4 = tempTimer(tm, function() killTimer(rageGUI.timers.fade4) rageGUI.timers.fade4 = nil raiseEvent("rageGUI fade", 0) end)
end
end
rageGUI.count = function()
rageGUI.previousRage = rageGUI.previousRage or 0 --initialise variable rageGUI.currentRage = rageGUI.myRage()
rageGUI.updateRagePane()
if rageGUI.myRage() ~= rageGUI.previousRage then -- rage changed rageGUI.previousRage = rageGUI.myRage()
elseif rageGUI.guibr_vars.fadewarn and rageGUI.myRage() > 0 then
end
end
rageGUI.set = function(arg1, arg2)
local vars = rageGUI.guibr_vars
if not vars[arg1] and arg2 ~= "true" and arg2 ~= "false" then rageGUI.echoN("Variable \'"..arg1.."\' not found, denied.")
else vars[arg1] = arg2 if tonumber(vars[arg1]) then vars[arg1] = tonumber(vars[arg1]) end rageGUI.echo("Variable \'"..arg1.."\' updated to \'"..vars[arg1].."\'. Use ") cechoLink("<pink>ragesave<reset>",[[rageGUI.save_guibr_vars()]],"alias: ragesave",true) cecho("<lavender_blush> to export.\n")
end
end
rageGUI.useAbility = function(ability)
local r = 0
local lblTbl = {rage1,rage2,rage3,rage4,rage5,rage6}
if tonumber(ability) then --pass position number or ability name r = tonumber(ability)
else for k, v in pairs(rageGUI.rageTable) do if rageGUI.rageTable[k][1] == ability then r = k break end end end
if r > 0 and r < 7 then --ability found
local tbl = rageGUI.rageTable[r] rageGUI.rageTimer("timerRage"..r,tbl[1]:title(),tbl[2],lblTbl[r])
if string.find(rageGUI.rageTable[r][6],"Aff:") then --denizen affliction local aff,_ = string.gsub(rageGUI.rageTable[r][6],"Aff:","") raiseEvent("rageGUI denizen gained aff", aff:lower()) end
end
end
rageGUI.rageFadeWarn = function(_, arg)
if arg >= 1 then rageGUI.echoN(rageGUI.myRage().." rage fading in "..math.floor(arg).." seconds") else rageGUI.echoN(rageGUI.myRage().." rage fading imminently!") end
end
rageGUI.tick = function()
end
rageGUI.showVars = function()
local kstr = "" local vstr = "" local cstr = ""
for k, v in pairs (rageGUI.guibr_vars) do if not (k == "element") then kstr = tostring(k) vstr = tostring(v) cstr = "rageset "..kstr.." "..vstr
cechoLink("<pink>"..kstr.."<reset>",[[printCmdLine("]]..cstr..[[")]],cstr,true) cecho((" "):rep(12-kstr:len()).."<white>:<reset> "..vstr.."\n") end
end
end
rageGUI.runOnce = function() if not rageGUI.alreadyRun then rageGUI.alreadyRun = true registerAnonymousEventHandler("gmcp.Char.Vitals","rageGUI.count") registerAnonymousEventHandler("gmcp.Char.Status.class","rageGUI.updateRageCaptions") registerAnonymousEventHandler("rageGUI fade","rageGUI.rageFadeWarn") registerAnonymousEventHandler("rageGUI system loaded","rageGUI.buildRagePane") if debugMode then rageGUI.echo("DEBUG: Event handlers created") end end end
raiseEvent("rageGUI system loaded") rageGUI.runOnce()

Script.name: Battlerage event handler
Script.script:
-- BATTLERAGE EVENT HANDLER -- for example
rageGUI = rageGUI or {}
rageGUI.rageEventHandler = function(event, arg)
if event == "rageGUI denizen gained aff" then if rageGUI.guibr_vars.showaffs then rageGUI.echo("Gained aff "..arg)
end
elseif event == "rageGUI denizen lost aff" then if rageGUI.guibr_vars.showaffs then rageGUI.echo("Lost aff "..arg) end
elseif event == "rageGUI rage balance" then if arg == "lost" then rageB:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.off)
else rageB:setStyleSheet(rageGUI.on)
end
end
end
registerAnonymousEventHandler("rageGUI denizen gained aff","rageGUI.rageEventHandler") registerAnonymousEventHandler("rageGUI denizen lost aff","rageGUI.rageEventHandler") registerAnonymousEventHandler("rageGUI rage balance","rageGUI.rageEventHandler")
--registerAnonymousEventHandler("rageGUI event", "rageGUI.rageEventHandler")

Script.name: Battlerage release notes
Script.script:
-- RAGEGUI RELEASE NOTES
--[[
v1.8.2 fixed Pierce (Sylvan 3) to display correctly and use correct command - Thanks Jack
v1.8.1 fixed Scourge (Fire Elemental Lord 2) to be sensitivity, not stun - thanks Jack fixed issue where female Elemental Lords (Elemental Ladies) were not correctly capturing added most of Water Elemental Lord, still missing level 5 ability with affs - thanks Shirszae and Veldrin
v1.8 added support for air, earth and fire elemental lords -- thanks to Mathilda for earth -- thanks to Minifie for fire
v1.7.4 added alternate line in magnesium trigger for Alchemist - thanks Shub (again!)
v1.7.3 fixed typo in miasma trigger for Alchemist - thanks Shub
v1.7.2 added trigger and info for Shin Shatter (blademaster 3) - thanks Thalak
v1.7.1 updated Chrono Erasure (depthswalker 4) to reflect synergy with amenesia and recklessness - thanks Tydas fixed typo 'gold dragon' to 'golden dragon' - thanks Aegoth fixed issues with priest level 1 and 4 abilities - thanks Drual tidied up Release Notes
v1.7 added Depthswalker class - thanks Ahmet added 'rageshow' alias to display rageGUI variables added 'rageset' alias to allow updating of variables without directly editing scripts added clickable links to rageshow output to write to command line updated Blademaster shield breaking rage ability to shin shatter - thanks Zulah
v1.6 fixed 'gold dragon' typo to 'golden dragon' corrected serpent flagellate aff from aeon to sensitivity - thanks Rangor updated labels with more consistent names of conditional affs - thanks Rangor added new variable, votb, to support characters with Vambraces of the Berserker
v1.5 fixed 'ragegui' alias to toggle visibility of the GUI added in event for gmcp.Char.Status.class to update GUI removed redundant dragonform / lesserform triggers fixed table to use class for dragons corrected typo in Ensconce (Jester level 4 ability) - thanks Ezran added animated timer to show rage fading - suggested by Azuros added new variable rageGUI.guibr_vars to delay start of fade animated timer (defaults to 5 seconds) added event 'rageGUI fade' to timeout warnings fixed issue with settings not correctly saving / loading
v1.4 update to fix errors brought about by dragon colour in GMCP added alias 'ragegui' to toggle visibility of the GUI - bugged
v1.3 fixed order of Runewarden abilities - thanks Kyrra and Ziri created new function, useAbility, to go off ability name or position in table - thanks Volge added triggers and info for excoriate and obliviate - thanks Dairon and Rangor
v1.2 added horrify and crack (priest) lines - thanks Silas added sentinel lines - thanks Praxides
v1.1 recklessness duration increased to 15 seconds battlerage fade increased to 15 seconds various typo and bug-fixes
v1.0 added occultist lines - thanks Seragorn added jester lines - thanks Leliel added blademaster lines - thanks Cronos and Praxides added level check for when buttons light up updated codebase to account for new third level ability for all classes added shieldbreak trigger lines for all dragon colours, alchemist, bard, druid, infernal, magi and runewarden
v0.9.1 added check for getMudletVersion() to ensure on Mudlet 3+
v0.9 added extra line for Stormflare (silver dragon) - thanks Kard added Svo prompt tag rageGUIrage added trigger for Sear (druid) with recklessness - thanks Kei tooltips now visible when hovering over battlerage abilities tooltips rewritten renamed rageGUI.rageEcho() to rageGUI.echoN() added rageGUI.echo() for in-line echoes added rageGUI.set() to update variables added rageset alias rewrote rageGUI.rageKey() to call rageGUI.rageClick()
v0.8.1 moved rageGUI.rageEcho() to earlier in script block to fix error with loading
v0.8 implemented gmcp event handler for Rage value changes - rageGUI rage balance current rage count displayed on rage balance indicator repurposed Rage change trigger to only affect decay timers fixed typo in Corrupt (shaman) trigger updated setClickCallback to prevent error spam updated antimer detection routine moved most functions and variables into rageGUI namespace events renamed to include rageGUI at the beginning, eg 'denizen lost aff' becomes 'rageGUI denizen lost aff' updated typo in name of Stormbolt (magi) trigger added cost in rage to ability indicator / buttons added confirmation echo to rageGUI.save_guibr_vars()
v0.7 Fixed issue with [Rage] lines not being gagged Added option to suppress denizen aff gain / loss - guibr_vars.showaffs Added warnings 6, 3 and 1 second before rage fades, can be disabled using guibr_vars.fadewarn Added variable to supress rage fade warnings (new option in guibr_vars table) Added trigger for gold dragon aeon fading Added Rage Balance indicator in BattleRage window, using events to update Updated denizen affliction timings based on HELP BATTLERAGE Fixed typo in Glaciate (blue dragon) trigger Added triggers for fading black dragon afflictions Added triggers for fading blue dragon afflictions Added triggers for fading red dragon afflictions
v0.6 Added sensitivity line to Mindblast (monk) trigger Added rageversion alias to display version Fixed lua error when trying to use abilities with no clientside "target" variable Fixed issue with Apple OS adding numbers to exported settings file
v0.5 Added shaman lines (thanks Mosr) Added rage1 to rage5 aliases to use battlerage abilities fixed animated timers reference, will now use demonnic.anitimer, aliased to anitimer
-- v0.4 -- Added druid lines (thanks Kei) -- Fixed trigger for Spike (infernal) to be generic, instead of only for fire wyrms -- Fixed missing spaces in Scramble and Tornadokick (monk) triggers -- Fixed missing word in Firefall (magi) trigger -- Added affliction events to Magi triggers -- Added affliction events to Monk triggers
-- v0.3 -- Added release notes (you're reading them!) -- Sylvan lines added (thanks Ryvaine) -- Infernal lines added (thanks Elazar) -- Moved Corrode out of Monk and back to Dragon 4 where it should have been (thanks Kard) -- Added in warning if Anitimer code not installed -- Added in rage balance tracking - rageBal -- Added events for rage balance loss / gain -- Added trigger for green dragon inhibit loss -- Added trigger for green dragon weakness loss -- Updated affliction times for level 5 dragon abilities to 6 seconds
-- v0.2 -- Added Alchemist rage lines (thanks Sena) -- Added most Serpent rage lines (thanks Mageta) -- Added a couple more Denizen Lost Aff lines
-- v0.1 -- Alpha release
-- A user-configurable GUI element is built which automatically updates battlerage abilities, dynamically displaying -- when your character has sufficient rage stored to use the ability, with an animated timer showing the cooldown. An -- event is raised when the ability is used, which can be scripted using an event handler (an example is included) for -- relaying to party, etc.
-- User configuration options include GUI size, position, colours
-- Rage abilities for all dragon colours and adventurer classes are included.
-- Clicking the GUI element corresponding to the rage ability will attempt to use the ability. There are no checks included -- for amount of rage, rage balance, etc, it is as if the commands have been manually entered. For extra convenience, hotkeys -- CTRL+1 to 5 also send the commands to the MUD.
-- Triggers are included for the following: -- All dragon colours (except successful level 4 rages) -- Bard (except successful level 4 rage) -- Magi -- Monk -- Paladin -- Priest Runewarden
]]--
